1.text: Pick a heavyweight, tight-woven fabric for both layers of the mask.

2.text: Use a preshrunk 100% cotton T-shirt as an easy option.

3.text: Cut up a pillowcase if you don’t have a T-shirt.

4.text: Pair different colors or patterns so it’s easy to identify the front.

5.text: Make sure your hands and surfaces are clean.

6.text: Print and cut out the face mask pattern.

7.text: Fold both pieces of fabric in half with the “good” sides facing in.

8.text: Trace the pattern onto the backside of your outer fabric piece.

9.text: Cut out the outer pieces with an extra 1.5 in (3.8 cm) side margin.

10.text: Trace the pattern onto the backside of your liner fabric.

11.text: Cut out the liner pieces using fabric scissors.

12.text: Put the liner pieces together with the smooth side facing inward.

13.text: Sew along the traced seam on the nose edge of the liner fabric.

14.text: Line up the outer pieces with the pattern on the inside.

15.text: Sew the outer pieces together along the traced nose seam.

16.text: Iron the seams on each fabric piece so they lay flat.

17.text: Line up the outside seams on both pieces and pin them in place.

18.text: Sew along the traced line on the top and bottom of the mask.

19.text: Turn the mask right-side out and iron the seams flat.

20.text: Insert a 5.5 to 6 in (14 to 15 cm) floral wire into the top of the face mask.

21.text: Do a top stitch along the top side and bottom side for reinforcement.

22.text: Make a .25 in (0.64 cm) fold on the sides of the outer layer.

23.text: Sew the edge of the side loop down into the outer layer of fabric.

24.text: Fold the frayed edges of the liner inside and stitch seams on each side.

25.text: Push 1 end of the elastic through the channel on the side.

26.text: Wash the mask in laundry detergent and hot water before you use it.

27.text: Insert an air filter into the side of the mask for added protection.
